page.title: 11FARMING DARTMOOR
page.content: We visited the Hexts whose family have farmed in the area for over 500 years. The farm is still worked by 3 generations and great-grandmother still lives with the family.The women remembered cooking on the open fire with dried peat from the moor for fuel.They had a bread oven heated with faggots.The flour was ground at Cockingford Mill which is now in ruins.The evening we were there a sliced wrapped shop loaf was on the table.Meat was cooked on the fire in a camp kettle,which was also covered with peat.They had to brush the embers from the lid to open the pot and had to be careful not to be burnt by hot sparks.Now they ahve an electric generator and cook by electricity.They used to preserve food with salt but now use a refrigerator or deep freeze.
